CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1967, reads: "Circus At Bedside - Hundreds of children who can not go out to see "The Greatest Show on Earth" this week with the Ringling Brothers Barmun and Bailey Circus giving its 97th consecutive performance at the New Civic Arena, enjoyed a bedside preview as "Coco the Clown" went rollicking through the corridors at Children's Hospital, and stopping for an occasional bedside preview. An array of 400 performers will be seen during the five day stand and eight performances, which begins Wednesday, Nov. 1."
TitMainTitle: Coco the Clown seated on hospital bed entertaining little girl with legs in traction
